intro: Disparago laxifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf arrowleaf, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants with hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant features a slender, branching stem and pinnately compound leaves with a distinctive arrowhead shape. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Disparago laxifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
